intro: Phlomoides laciniata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved phlomoides, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a perennial herb that typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters. The plant features lance-shaped leaves that are finely toothed, giving it a distinctive appearance. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense spikes, often appearing in shades of blue or purple. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or dry habitats.
